pros: Decent pay. Friendly Nursing residency staff. Level- headed HR that tried helping- they are the only ones that get any stars here.
cons: Your experience will definitely depend heavily on what department you end up in. I ended up with straight up PTSD after managers’ and co- workers “ hazing”, lying and gaslighting behaviour. Pro tip- document everything that happens throughout the day.

pros: The orientation was several weeks long and the staff was supportive. Management was super nice and accommodating ti my school schedule.

job_title: Case Manager/UR Nurse in Arlington, VA
pros: PAY-Kind abut WORLOAD DOESN'T MATCH,
cons: Everything. Poor staff no use of PTO/Sick leave. Management sucks, unrealstic expectations. Poor pt statisfication due to clinical course NOT CM. High turnover rate. No breaks during the work week. Senior management needs to be changed and revamped. Poor communication. High needs patients with poor staffing makes for a disastrous work in environment. Quick unsafe discharges at times. Poor communication with physicians and patients. GOOD PART TIME JOB BUT AVOID AS A FULL-TIME CAREER. No time for work life balance and compensation does not match workload. Definitely need to offer bonus, Christmas, New Year and a thank you bonus. Management worried about patient stratification when VHC has to poorest ratings in all the hospitals in the DMV. Avoid it at all costs patient or employee. So much more I could say!

pros: Clean environment, attempts to promote a positive and patient-centered culture. Relatively easy to use patient portal and communicate with staff. Enjoyed the patient populations. Recruitment makes it look good! I had positive relationships with the multi-disciplinary patient team. Benefits are great.
cons: Lower wages compared to similar places in the area. Very poor experience with management in my dept- a lot of micro-management, condescending comments, gaslighting, and disorganization regarding patient care. Attempted to resolve with HR but when I arrived to the meeting my supervisor was sitting behind the desk with them…so obviously I didn’t feel supported.  Feels very “employees versus management”. The culture of the rehab dept was very toxic- a lot of gossiping, favoritism, generally unprofessional. Management screen-shotted my social media after I called out sick to question what I did that day (it was a mental health day with sever anxiety). Have since moved on to another hospital in the area with quite the opposite experience, thankfully. Another note- I do agree with other reviews about the systemic racism within the hospital structure and the hospital definitely portrays conservative values. Attempted to reach out to the person who responds to these reviews to discuss their “deep concern”…but had no response from them.

job_title: Senior Occupational Therapist in Arlington, VA

cons: Pandemic drained man power and burned people out.

Culture of Systemic Racism through top to bottom.

He made same public speech during social work month celebration. Met with Chief HR Officer and received zero support about report of Systemic Racism, bullying culture, and hostile and toxic work environment present in case management department.

Executive leadership knows about the historic and current problems in the department and still no changes.

review_title: Not a Good Place to Work for your Mental Health
pros: I can only think of 2: free parking and 100% coverage at the hospital under their insurance plan
cons:
Oh where do I begin...
-Managers who are bullies get promoted rather than discipline or being fired
-It's all about favoritism there between Assistant Directors and VPs
-Managers and HR will find any way possible to fire you for having mental illness such as depression. I watched this happen to at least 2 employees there from behind enemy lines. They will try to blame job performance but I've heard 2 current HR employees say they didn't want "crazy" people working at the hospital and whatever they say goes. 
-Looking for a competitive salary? You won't find it here unless you're an executive, nurse or physician. Their pay is horrible. 
-They won't put a dime into rewarding employees who don't work with patients and bring revenue to the hospital. 
-Very old school. Everything is still paper. You go to new hire orientation and you leave with a bag filled with paper. Very old and wasteful. It's 2016-go electronic. 
-PTO benefit is a joke. They'll tell you you're going to accrue so much in the year yet that is for everything - vacation, sick and even hospital recognized holidays
-Medical benefit premiums are incredibly high for being self-insured and a hospital

pros: Good pay, supportive staff, resources
cons: Parking situation is horrible, but they're working on fixing it.

review_title: challenging environment but committed to quality patient care
job_title: Staff Nurse, RN in Arlington, VA
pros: pay scale for staff rn decent, exciting changes being made to accomodate more Kaiser patients. Leadership that involved with direct patient care are supportive in what can be a difficult political situation with budget cuts.
cons: they take advantage that this economy makes it hard for people to leave. Directors are insensitive to demands made in what seems to be mean spirited at times.Parking is a disaster. Unrealistic expectation and poor coordination of mandatory inservices and meetings.

review_title: Poor management styles and wrong focus
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Alexandria, VA
pros: The only pro is the benefits very good 401k plan and the insurance
cons: I don’t know where to start. Many managers have very poor management styles. Due to budget cuts one PCD has 2 departments that is in charge off. They always have excuse like they have no time or they don’t take a proper action. They invest in people that do nothing are quite and don’t discuss or report anything. Many times other coworkers were sleeping or simply sitting around and not doing anything. Their unprofessional attitude and behavior made many times patients safety  in jeopardy. The executives and AVP focus only on numbers and the expansion they try to do. They never give superior on the evaluation due to not doing enough. While you are in the many councils or did projects in the department. Hard working people are never rewarded!!!!! Since management changed many employees that have been working there for over 10 year quit. In this past month I would have count at least 8 nurses have left the department. If you looking for place just to get experience and move one then go ahead but it’s not worth to be there longer than a 1-2.

pros: The pay is higher than other area hospitals.  The culture is great - people are nice and teamwork is strong. Nurses serve on all sorts of committees and are involved in the major decisions that are made.  Nurses have high expectations of themselves and of each other.  This leads to a workforce that is highly engaged and encouraging to one another.  This is pretty rare for a hospital - especially in this part of the country.  There is a lot of pride that you are a Virginia Hospital Center nurse. Parking is FREE!  All staff can now park on-site for FREE in the same garage as the patients.  The hspoital has lots of money to pay for nurse education and there are tons of opportunities for advancement.
cons: They hire a lot of new graduates (this is a pro if you are a new graduate), but you have to enjoy orienting new nurses if you are a more expereinced nurse.

pros: Pay for Patient Care Reps are only a few dollars less then their new RN’s , Free parking, big lunch room
cons: Micro managed, high turnover, talked down by co workers, co workers take longer lunches by clocking out before they go so they can be on the clock while they’re gone for over an hour, leaving others to have shorter lunches, too much personal talk at front desk area, Management caters to a select few, VP is a bully, if you voice your concern you will be retaliated against. Manager will blame front desk and MA ‘s for low patient scores to avoid having to consider the MD & patient experience. Patients complain about not being able to see there PCP as soon as they would like. However, CEO’s family is allowed to have same day and/or before hour provider non emergency appointments but they say all patients are VIP’s.

review_title: Mr. Cole needs to walk the walk not just talk
pros: Small and highly maneuverable and that is the only reason they get certain awards and distinctions. Its not that they are better they are just a little bit quicker.
cons: Talented people end up leaving and those remaining are lifers. The lifers do anything possible to keep their jobs. When new people come in, they figure this out and attach themselves to those lifers or they make a name for themselves and get out. This works out for everyone, people learn and enhance their marketability and the lifers get to stay.

review_title: Patient Care Representative for Physician Group
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Arlington, VA
pros: Beautiful Hospital, Environmental Services keeps the hospital very clean, inside and out. Cafeteria has good food, everyone seems to be very friendly in the hallways(Staff)
cons: The doctors are phony. They pretend to like their patients but soon as they leave, they talk very horribly about them. The hospital allows the Doctor's to treat the staff like crap, all while promoting an environment where an employee can go to HR to report abuse w/o retaliation , but what happens is, the employee will end up fired, not the doctor. I've seen this 4x. I've even witness a doctor yell and scream at an employee right in front of the entire office, patients included and nothing happened to the Doc. I've seen doctors team up on other doctors to have them fired.

review_title: chaotic changes lack of trust between staff and leadership
pros: Potential benefits of working with Kaiser as a partner may bring stability, there are dedicated staff members who truly care about the patients they serve.
cons: Older well paid employees seem to be targeted and feeling forced out and replaced with less experienced less costly staff. Their is no sense of loyalty every department head is focused on saving their job. The hospitals are taking advantage of the fact that there is no longer a nursing shortage.

job_title: Inpatient Physical Therapist in Arlington, VA
pros: Initially during my employment tenure VHC offered great scheduling flexibility and offered over-time pay for weekend work. Gradually these pro's disappeared.  The people that I worked with was an amazing group of caring and supportive teammates. Benefits and sick time at this hospital are also great. Also accessing doctors on campus was very convenient for your own care
cons: Pay at this hospital was about 10,000 less than the competitor INOVA for the same position. I was not able to park on campus which added 10-15 minutes to my commute time, and made me feel generally undervalued as an employee. The relationship between nurse management staff and rehab was often tense.  Ultimately I left my position because there were changes made in the rehab management staff and I found the new director to be unpredictable, this was stressful for me.

pros: Good coworkers, Efficient hospital - things get done, Good hospital staff - rns, case managers, pt/ot are hard working and good to work with, Salary and bonus is above average for area, Location of hospital
cons: Constantly overworked in terms of hours/patient load/number of night shifts, Hospitalist directors not truly concerned with hospitalist morale or well being (only look to replace old physicians when workload is unbearable for many months), High turnover of hospitalists (multiple MDs who have left during first 3 months of job & many other MDs have left during last couple years), stagnant salary (does not increase any with experience, no cost of living increase), poor schedule compared to other hospitalist programs (lots of night shifts, very little notice on getting next month's schedule - usually less than a week ), poor leadership - lots of failed promises by medical directors, not good job if you want to have family or life outside of work, not a position that anyone can be at for more than a couple years.

pros: The benefits are good if you go there to use them there.
cons: Management and Upper Management do not care how short staffed their departments get, they offer no help, no solution, no thank yous for hurting ourselves while continue to work in unsafe work environments. When you ask for help you are ignored and pushed around and bullied. Pepole continue to quit because of frustration and bring bullied that is being ignored

pros: The only pro i can think of with this company is the rate of pay(if not considering the work load) and the health benefits
cons: you first think they you are being paid well until you start working here and realize how much your work load is.They don't respect their employees and aren't transparent with their expectations.They barely train you but expect you to know everything and if you don't  perform up to their expectations they will either extend your probationary period or let you go.HR only looks out for the company and the doctors.The only advice i can give is to stay far away from this place.there is a reason why they have a high turn over rate.it's a joke

pros: Pay is great. Staff is friendly.
cons: Short staffed many nights. Pt load is usually 5 -6 patients. So many  employees thinking the grass is greener on the other side, but its not. I've heard its like this everywhere. Main problem is can't see staff long enough to hire more people . If they waited around longer, the staffing issue would be solved. Would like to get charge nurse pay too.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Arlington, VA
pros:
This hospital has pretty good benefits (401 K match, good health insurance plan, etc). 
Bi annual employee surveys that let us give feedback to management.
cons:
I think the pay is a little on the low side, especially considering the very high cost of living in the area. 
Annual raises have been capped at only 3%, and very few if any employees actually get that. For example, I have always gotten "superior" reviews but that only seems to be worth a 2% raise in management's opinion.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Arlington, VA
pros: Free parking is all I can come up with
cons: I was hired as a new grad and was rotated between 3 preceptors. 2 of them could have cared less about teaching and really made it apparent they were chosen simply because the particular day I was working they had the majority of experience. My primary preceptor had been fired from Inova for narcotic diversion (great choice!). The hospital has ZERO personality and ppl walk around like zombies. I could only stand it for a little over a month and left to a nearby hospital in DC where I was offered $32 and given a preceptor who genuinely cared about teaching me.  Any new grads who are thinking of working here save your time and energy and apply somewhere else.

pros: employees and their family members have access to great providers, benefits are OK, lots of efforts to improve the clinical area of the business
cons: except the recent training on the Epic system, there are absolutely no learning opportunities for non-clinical positions to grow in their professional fields, gain new skills and improve; thin resources in non-clinical areas are very stretched.

review_title: Labor and Delivery Unit. Friendly co-workers; helpful and caring administration.
pros: The overall feel of VHC is friendly and welcoming. The doctors respect the nurses and there is great team work among all the staff. You get to work with a wide variety of cultures and social backgrounds. The L&D rooms are attractive and well equipped.  There is a big emphasis on family care and keeping parents and babies together as much as possible.
cons:
Like with most hospitals, staffing is often an issue, but has seen much improvement over the past few years. 
It would be nice to be able to offer families more accomadations for "natural" birthing (there are no tubs for instance).

review_title: It is about outlook and attitude
pros: I've found my employment here a rewarding experience.  The challenges we face are no different than those that are experienced by most hospitals in the health care sector.  If you are looking for a challenge, and to make a difference, bring your hard work and a good attitude to this place and be part of the team.
cons: We provide the best for our patients, and that takes commitment and hard work.  Unfortunately, there is no room for applicants and employees who are not willing to make the kind of commitment that everyone else is willing to make.

review_title: Definitely one of the best hospitals in the area if you're a patient.
pros: Willing to hire new grads. Good benefits. Can typically choose your own schedule. A heavy emphasis is placed on education and staying up to date.
cons: Staffing shortage. Too much emphasis being placed on being the best hospital. They should make equal attempts to be one of the best employers. Stress levels are high and no one seems to care about the employees.

pros: The patients were so interesting. Most from a wealthy educated background. They wanted to know everything about their healthcare. Pay was decent. Benefits were awful.
cons:
HCAHPS score was all that really mattered to the Administrative team. They were not concerned with the reality of patient care, just the dream they were the best of the best.
Would not tolerate the nurses having opinions or ideas that were in contrast to theirs.

pros: The pay was comparable to other companies at the time. The health insurance wasn't cheap by any means but it was affordable. The office had updated technology.
cons: The office I worked in, an outpatient office, was terrible. Essentially the entire staff turned over every 6 months. The atmosphere was awful. The other employees were very unwelcoming, childish, and had no concept of team work. The annual raises are the lowest I've ever seen and they boast about education assistance but you have to jump through hoops to even try to apply for acceptance into the tuition assistance program .

job_title: Imaging Informatics Systems Engineer in Arlington, VA
pros: I work in the IT field for the hospital and have done so for the last seven years.  I love the people I support and it's rare to find an empolyee who doesn't like it here as well... (Please read con)
cons: Middle to upper management (all the way up) is like Game of Thrones (IT/Radiology department).  Everyone tries to consolidate power, place people where they don't need to be, place blame like no one's business.  I mean, I'm sure it's like this a lot of places but it definitely doesn't change much when you have a lot of long timers here.

review_title: Poor management; Good benefits; You will be spread thin
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Arlington, VA
pros: The benefits they offer and compensation are definitely competitive for the area. They really push to hire within, so there are many opportunities that are available for employees.
cons: There seems to be some disorganization when you reach the management level and go higher. Certain "leaders" lack the knowledge of how each office really works, and others just lack the capability to fulfill their responsibilities. They really spread thin their high performing employees, and eventually end up driving them out.

review_title: Caring Environment With Lots of Problems
pros: Great co-workers and an appreciation for the needs of patients. Very supportive nursing environment. My coworkers were like my sisters. All rooms are private and many of the doctors are very helpful and caring. There are employee forums where you can voice you opinion and make your needs known. Sometimes you can actually see changes. The patient services staff was great.
cons: Poor staffing and limited respect for retaining experienced RNs. There is no charge nurse differential and the unit I worked on gave the charge nurse the same number of patients as all the others despite the increase in responsibility. Management is very removed from bedside nursing and does not seem to understand the stresses of having such acute patients. 3 different EMR systems are used throughout the hospital and none of them talk to each other in a cohesive way. The MDs that have minimal respect for nurses are rarely reprimanded for their inappropriate behavior (I want to be clear that there are many MDs there who are caring and absolutely wonderful including the hospitalist group). HAND WRITTEN DOCTOR'S NOTES! Very difficult to follow the plan of care when you cannot read the note. Often I would learn from my patients that they were discharged because the doctor didn't notify me.

review_title: All about money no loyality to to older workers
job_title: Senior Medical Technologist in Arlington, VA
pros: A great place to work, salary's are comparable to local hospitals, good benefits
cons: Its all about saving money no loyalty to employees who have worked there a long time, I know of many senior management workers who were forced to retire so that they could be replaced with younger workers at much lower salaries

pros: Good experience building. Fellowship gets you lots of exposure to patient care and high risk. Excellent nurses and most physicians are a pleasure to work with. Benefits package  is 5 star!
cons: LOTS of nurse turnover. 20 RNs left full time in one year. Staffing is usually very tight, overcrowded schedule and not a lot of attention to needs of night shift staffing. The contract you sign when you start is basically up to the administrations discretion and WILL change, retention bonuses non-existent.

pros:
-Friendly patient population
-Small, family-like hospital environment
-Great supervisor
-Great staff
-Fair pay
cons:
-The Radiology Department at VHC is terribly-run! Very hierarchical and so hyperspecialized that there is not enough communication between the various segments of Radiology (e.g. Radiologists, receptionists, technicians, etc.)
-Radiologists are extremely rude

pros: Very friendly staff, nice managers, reasonable schedule, nurses park on-site
cons: low pay relative to cost of living in area-most employees have to travel long distances or work multiple jobs. It seems that many nurses come to VHC to get 1-2 years of experience and then leave to a more affordable/better paying area. Poor match of 401k and no match in first year

pros:
- Opportunity for multi-vendor and multi-specialty equipment experience
- Good benefits: health, PTO, work/life balance
- Flexibility to self manage 
- Patient care and safety driven environment
cons:
- Pay is not competitive
- Lack of proactive approach to professional development
- Work politics and lack of willingness for conflict resolution with personnel

pros: Best places for RN’s focuses on professional growth, nursing staff has support with career management team. They promote from within. And that makes the hospital the best to work in the area.
cons: Pay could be better. Insurance is expensive. Work load can be heavy. Stocks in old way of doing things. Short staff. Need to invest more on teaching staff.

pros: RNs committed to great care; great doctors; friendly staff; education reimbursement opportunities; self schedule in some areas; pretty nice facility.
cons:
Management: some directors are okay (two in particular are outstanding). Bullying behavior is pervasive, starts at the top, towards middle managers and staff.  
Staffing: other hospitals have the same problem, but here, no end in sight. Unsafe becoming the norm. 
Parking: ridiculous.

job_title: Patient Care Director in Arlington, VA
pros: Good patient population. Staff engaged in patient care.
cons: The executive leadership has finger pointing and blaming down to perfection. They do no take ownership for the problems that they create by their own budgetary constraints.  The former CNO was known for harassing and bullying leadership.  The current CNO has taking her lead to humilate and disrespect the entire nursing services team. Leadership turnover and vacancies are high. Mr. Cole, the CEO, does not bother to form a relationship with the director level to value their hard work.

pros: Clinical staff is awesome - dedicated to providing the highest quality of care
cons: There is a rot in the leadership level.  Something itsnt right. It’s like a lot of people have been there too long and have lost perspective and it trickles down. The CNO they hired recently is a useless self-promoter, nothing like the previous nursing leadership. I’m hanging on in the hopes that the CEO figures this out and ends it before it gets worse.  Visionary clinical leadership is needed ... NOW!

pros: The staff is friendly and easy to work with.  Everyone seems eager to give the best care to the patients.
cons: When staffing is short there didn't seem to be a good plan to fill gaps, like a float pool to call in when someone can't make it to work.

review_title: Day two of orientation and I am loving the culture.
job_title: Epic Principal Trainer, Instruction and Design in Arlington, VA
pros:
Rigorous selection process.
Great benefits.

Employees are valued, their opinion is sought out before making changes to processes that affect their work.

All the senior leadership with a Chief and Officer in their name welcome you on day one and introduce themselves and their service area, yes including CEO, President and all VP’s and Directors.
cons: On site parking, cafeteria food options are limited. No coffee and Tea options available for orientation.

job_title: Patient Care Representative in Arlington, VA
pros: Benefits are okay, I love the patients, SOME of the hospital staff is friendly.
cons: Upper management is horrible. You're just a number to this company, They do hiring twice a month, Turn over rate is extremely high, No employee parking (You have to catch a shuttle and parking is an issue), Lack of communicate within the hospital, Hospital is very cliquish so its extremely hard to move up and around without having to kiss a little butt to do so, not so friendly environment.

pros: Working with VHC is a great experience for me, they care about there company growth by Improving patient care and employee by improving your skills.
cons: Probably the parking lot, you are designated to park 2 miles from the hospital and take a shuttle coz availability is really low coz of the higher quantity of patients. Except for night crews and evening shift

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Arlington, VA
pros:
The benefits are great
Most people seem to be really kind
cons: Some nurses and doctors won't help the PCAs because they're "too busy" or "its not their job." But they're actually just lazy and feel that the work is beneath them. But that behavior can be found in any and every hospital.

review_title: Best Hospital to work for in the area!
pros: Very friendly culture, great benefits, professional growth opportunities and wonderful hard working people!  VHC offers a very transparent environment and always looking at ways to improve.  Management is very supportive and collaborative.
cons: I can't really think of anything, however parking is an issue.

pros: health benefits are really great. All ER visits are free and if you see any doctors within the hospital physician group copay is only $10
cons: This hospital cares more about getting high ratings from patients than their employees. You can only get promoted or further up the ladder if you suck up to management or know someone.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Arlington, VA
pros: Most of my co-worker were awesome. Friendly staff, security team was great.
cons: Some of the nurses are lazy and don't appreciate having a good Patient Care Assistant, favoritism happened a lot here. Management isn't as productive or proactive as they could be when it comes to patient care or listening to the concerns of the staff. Especially night shift workers.

review_title: Must be willing to suck up to management
pros: Great benefits, Great pay AND that's about it! Culture is Terrible within the physician group.
cons: Must be willing to kiss up to physicians, most days I felt like instead of coming to a professional work environment...I was coming to HIGH SCHOOL! If you want to come to work, do your job and leave and not join the "it crowd"...you will be picked on. Managers only promote ppl who kiss up to them, not on ability to perform your job duties.

pros:
close to home, multicultural representation among staff.
VHC has won magnet status and in one of the top 100 Best Hospitals.
cons:
It is busy on all floor all the time, seem like they are understaffed at times. 
High rate of employee turnout, Hiring many new grads.

pros: A good size hospital-big enough to be good but not too big.  Has a culture of listening to employees. Community members really like the hospital.
cons: High turnover on some floors. Inadequate float pool. Limited parking. Cafeteria pricing. PTO has limited carryover.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Arlington, VA
pros: Low drama, management does listen and respond to employees concerns and needs. Employee health makes yearly quals easy to accomplish-which is phenomenal when are on the night shift. Friendly people that are all patient and team oriented
cons: Parking can be difficult to impossible late in the day.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Arlington, VA
pros: Flexible schedule, ability to advance, learning opportunities, health insurance, cheap exercise classes, nice surrounding area, clean facilities, only work 3 days a week.
cons: Pay could be better, long 12 hour shifts, relationship among coworkers could be improved.

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Washington, DC
pros: I worked in the ER.  The shift coverage was never fully staffed.  Some FT employees didn't have permanent schedules.  Most of the time schedules were produced 1 week before it began.
cons: Management does not take staff members seriously.

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Fairfax, VA
pros: I loved my time at VHC as an ER tech. I had a few people as buddies during my training. Learned so much and earned life long friends! Management was fabulous and if i could, i would totally go back.
cons: Parking was sometimes difficult if i worked during midday shifts but thats just any busy hospital.

pros: Very supportive leadership and there are many opportunities to grow professionally.  Everyone is very friendly and come to work with a positive attitude to take care of our patients.
cons: The parking could be improved. I think that all staff should be able to park on campus, especially all nurses.

pros: Only pros that come to mind are the benefits and pay. Do not sell your soul to the devil. Run
cons: Low staffing, cut throat, deceiving, very political, no sympathy for working parents with sick children. Poor management. Flawed system which sets up employees to fail

pros: Pleasant MDs to work with, friendly nurses, benefits are reasonable
cons: Staffing! Understaffed and unsafe are norms at this hospital. Nurse overload. Parking is also an issue, got locked out of offsite garage in Balston very late at night. Needs improvement with relations with parking contractors. Bullying by managers, hospital not easy to get to.

pros: I really enjoyed the patient interaction. The staff at the hospital is friendly as well, overall a great work enviornment.
cons: The location is in a heavily congested traffic area I lived about 20 miles from the hospital and I took me about an hour to get there.

job_title: Assistant Patient Care Director in Arlington, VA
pros: Good community feel, decent pay, clean facility, management really believes in the hospitals mission to be the best. Lots of opportunities to grow.
cons: Management can lack empathy with staff. Engagement metrics are the thing that matters most, often at the expense of staff satisfaction.

pros: Absolutely amazing learning experience. Everyone really tries their best to make sure you learn as much as possible. All staff were friendly and great teachers.
cons: Not trauma certified, but still see plenty and learn a lot

pros:
Hires new grads 
Health insurance 
Fellowships for new grads 
Learning experience 
As a nurse here I really learned how to think on me feet quickly
cons: Mr hey hire new grads on the floors mostly, there are not very many resources for new grads . There is a high rate of turn over . It seems like every week we are required to learn or do something new. Pay is lower than other hospitals

review_title: Hospital with a Culture of Caring
job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Arlington, VA
pros:
Great community
Good benefits
Tuition reimbursment
Flexible scheduling
Opportunities to learn
cons:
Confusing parking
Confusing campus
Coworkers (never know what you're gonna get)
Pay could be higher

pros: Pay is great, staff quite good
cons: if only possible to balance life and work, I mean a schedule that can allow you to work and live a quality life

pros: Flexibility to learn and work on various modalities with the completion of preventative/corrective maintenance.
cons: Poor oversight of management in regards to career development of team members, conflict resolution, and compensation.

job_title: TECH and RN in Arlington, VA
pros: Parking, Pay is decent but lower than area, focused on patient care,  highly educated staff and management
cons: pro-patient not about the staff,  staffing seems to be always changing

review_title: Floor Nurse, Unit Diabetes and Wound Champion
pros: Excellent Fellowship program.  Involved in case management.  Gain Magnant recognition and dibetes center for excellence while I was working at VHC.
cons: I can't identified any cons at this time

job_title: Duty Supervisor in Temple Hills, MD
pros: A friendly people to work with, A great place to work.
cons: The way they did when they let us go.  The company did not offer us a job.

pros:
Supportive environment
Engaged nursing staff
Everyone works as a team
cons: Would like a new EHR - This is a current project and should be resolved soon.

pros: Community hospital in dynamic, cosmopolitan area
cons: Siloed service lines and departmental politics marred Foundation's mission as of 2017.

pros: good benefits for their employees
cons: They still make you pay back tuition re-imbursement even if they don't have a job for you

pros: Benefits, employeee friendly, flexible schedule
cons: as a part-time employee challeneges arise with the mandatoryemployee forums and in-services that require me to use pto at my full time job

review_title: Very successful business plan, nurse friendly and opportunity to be successful.
pros: Quality leadership, flexible scheduling, most people are satisfied with their job
cons: parking can be a pain

pros: Friendly staff, the location is convenient
cons: They're a big business, they tend to see you as an employee vs. an individual. Employee parking is a disaster.

pros: Strong unity, RN focused, good benefits
cons: Some MDs are not the best... but mostly just kaiser doctors

job_title: Systems Assistant Vice President, Managed Care in Arlington, VA
pros: We all share a common thread of gratitude and respect for our patients and co workers.
cons: Nothing notable yet or not in process of being fixed

job_title: Executive Director Technician in Arlington, VA
pros: Teamwork, culture, location, the people.
cons: The pay could be better considering the cost of living. Parking could be better.

pros: Good benefits, campus is nice
cons: Never fully staffed, no room for professional growth, no work-life balance, pay is low

pros: Great insurance and dental, 401 k . Lunch discount is great
cons: Hard to get a day off, no rise no matter how great u are at your job

pros: great for those with little experience to gain experience
cons: average remuneration and benefits for staff

pros:
Decent co-workers
Love the work
Benefits are ok
cons:
Nurse:Patient ratio is high
Documentation changes every week
Parking sucks!
Unrealistic expectations

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Arlington, VA
pros: great pay and benefits, supervisors are willing to work with your schedule
cons: off site parking, long hours, and too many task to be done

job_title: Technical Support Specialist in Arlington, VA
pros: Friendly environment and good some great people to work with
cons: Management doesn’t appreciate hard work

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Arlington, VA
pros: Good benefits, great 401k matching, strong nursing community.
cons: No night shift support, pays less than other hospitals in the area.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Falls Church, VA
pros: This hospital gives employees great health benefits
cons: terrible parking , frequent management changes

job_title: New Grad RN in Arlington, VA
pros: Staff are super supportive of each other and new grads.
cons: The hospital is in a pricey area. The pay could be higher.

pros: Excellent and competitive benefits . Good PTO
cons: Not really that I can think off

pros:
Professional management
Known for great patient care.
cons:
Long hiring process.
Parking on campus is challenging.

pros: shared governance; evidence based practice
cons: need more staff; need to pay better

pros: Reputation of hospital, health insurance, location, private rooms for patients, ease of communication with physicians, communication with immediate supervisor, Cyracom translation telephones
cons: Nursing is dangerously understaffed, management does nothing despite complaint of staff and is insulting, quality and selection of food. Unhealthy food choices.

job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in Arlington, VA
pros: Really nice people to work with
cons: I don’t like my current boss

pros: -Helpful staff taught me a lot about being a pharmacy technician
cons: -Wish I could have volunteered longer

pros: positive work culture, room to grow, pay
cons: functions as a community hospital, strict on budget and somewhat old school

pros: Good working environment and learning experience
cons: Very Low Salary and unavailability of parking space on site

pros: Advancement and tuition reimbursement, FSA is a plus

pros: Benefits, managers, staff, friendly faces
cons: Cant think of anything negative for this hospital

pros: Community, Pay, Growth, Culture and management

pros: Great environment and very excellent staff.

pros: Good place to work. Parking is free

pros: Not a good place to work lots of bullying and they dont pay good doing multi tasking job
